snippet: More's. Then there is Trinity House, and the birthplace of William  Penn, for he was born on Tower Hill, I sometimes stood there alone in a reflecting mood, and, regardless of the showman who exhibited his learned birds and quadrupeds, called to mind the scenes witnessed on that spot in other days, when crowds gathered there to look upon such as were brought forth to die. The grass grows green in the once fetid moat, and flowers bloom on the place that soaked the gore of the too often innocent who sufi"ered there ; but the earth is the same now as when executions were common on the spot, although time and policies are changed, and my fancy often pictured before me the assembled crowd waiting  to witness a fellow-being die.
